news_header: Three buses exploded near Tel Aviv amid rising tensions following the return of hostages' remains.
news_original_title: Bodies of youngest kidnapped Israelis returned by Hamas as ceasefire holds
news_text: Near Tel Aviv, three buses exploded in a suspected militant attack, heightening tensions in Israel after the return of four hostages' remains held by Hamas. The U.N. condemned the taunting during the handover. While the incident sparked outrage, many Israelis felt relief for the return of living hostages. The bodies of Ariel and Kfir Bibas and their mother, Shiri, were returned, evoking grief. Another victim, Oded Lifshitz, was identified as having been killed in captivity over a year ago. Prime Minister Netanyahu vowed to avenge the deaths, while families of hostages awaited the return of their loved ones. Recently, three hostages were released, leading to emotional reunions in their community.
